On 7 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack on a SNA (military) check point between Danow and Golweyn villages (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab retreated.

On 6 July 2020, Govt security forces (military) clashed with Al Shabaab militants during an operation in Jidow village (Baydhaba, Bay). The forces captured two Al Shabaab militants who were responsible for planting IEDs on the road between Awdinle and Berdaale town.

On 6 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a Govt forces convoy (military) travelling from Mogadishu to Jowhar near Qalimow village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). Three soldiers were killed in the attack, Al Shabaab militants retreated.

On 6 July 2020, local security forces conducted a security operation in several neighborhood targeting accused Al Shabaab militants in Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). Over forty young people were arrested in relation for the recent RCIED attack in Baidoa town.

On 6 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants burnt down a civilian truck transporting fuel to Sector 5 headquater (Jowhar) in Ceel Geelow village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). Three civilians were also killed in the attack.

On 6 July 2020, an armed clash between SNA (military) and police forces (Hirshabelle) occurred at Hantiwadag village neighbourhood in Jowhar town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle) over a land dispute. One soldier guarding Hirshabelle state palace nearby was killed in the clash.

On 5 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked police officers (Southwest Special Police Forces) in Aawdiinle village (Baydhaba, Bay). Five militants were killed and six other injured in the attack. Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 5 July 2020, a Hawadle clan militia shot and killed a man affiliated to the Abgal clan in Coomaad village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). There is inter-clan conflict between Hawadle and Habargedir clans and it is presumed the victim was mistakenly believed to be from Habargedir clan.

On 5 July 2020, clan clashes broke out between Reer Mataan and Celi Cumar sub clan militias over a land dispute in Fila-Dheere village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). Four people were killed and six others injured from both sides.

On 4 July 2020, a luxury car that was loaded with explosive (UVIED) devises detonated at a security post manned by police officer near the taxes department in front of seaport in Mogadishu-Hamar Jabjab district (Hamar Jabjab, Banadir). Five police officers and three civilian bystanders sustained injuries. The suicide bomber died in the blast.

On 4 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants killed a man from Makane clan caught chewing khat in Macala village near Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The militants have forbidden the use of miira/khat in their controlled areas.

On 4 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a civilian man transporting miira/khat on the outskirts of Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). The militants banned the delivery and transportation of miira/khat in areas under their control.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)

On 18 May 2020, a suspected Al shabaab militant shot and seriously injured a Govt security officer (assumed military) at Ceelasha Biyaha settlement (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The perpetrators managed to escape, the police forces conducted search operation and arrested one suspect.

On 18 May 2020, suspected Al shabaab militants kidnapped two civilian males belonging to the Garikombe sub clan at Gawoow Gabdhoore settlement in the vicinity of Kismayo town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). The kidnapped were distributing food items which was donated by Somalis from the diaspora.
On 18 May 2020, security forces (Military) backed by Southwest administration forces (Military) killed seven Al shabaab militants in an operation near Aawdiinle village (Baydhaba, Bay).

On 18 May 2020, a hand grenade was hurled at a Govt security forces (military) checkpoint near Buulo Folyo village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The soldiers reacted with gunfire in the direction of the suspected source of the attack.

On 18 May 2020, unidentified gunmen threw a hand grenade at Govt troops (assumed military) at a checkpoint in the Isse Abdi village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The forces reacted with gunfire after the explosion.

On 17 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out an attack against a Govt military base located in Mukaiga village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After exchange of heavy gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 17 May 2020, a suicide bomber detonated an explosive laden tri wheeler at the Governor's office in Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The explosions killed the governor along with four of his security officers.

On 17 May 2020, a RCIED detonated by Al shabaab targeting security forces (military) vehicle between Digfeer Hospital and Tarabuunka neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The explosion killed one soldier and injured two others.

On 17 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out an attack against a Govt forces (military) checkpoint located at Cumar Beerre village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Govt forces responded and Al shabaab militants retreated.

notes: On 17 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked the AMISOM/Jubaland security forces base at Kolbiyow town (Badhaadhe, Lower Juba). Al shabaab claimed to have killed two soldiers after exchange of heavy gunfire from both sides and Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
notes: On 17 May 2020, US forces conducted an airstrike targeting Al Shabaab strongholds in Kuunyo-Barrow village (Jilib, Middle Juba). The airstrike killed two Al shabaab militants. It also impacted civilians of the town, with three children and their mother sustaining major injuries, they were rushed to the hospital.
On 17 May 2020, unidentified aircraft (assumed Kenyan) fired four rounds of rockets reportedly targeting Al shabaab base in the Bulo Gaduud area (Baardheere, Gedo).

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force

On 17 May 2020, a remote controlled IED (RCIED) targeting a toyota pickup carrying police personnel detonated and damaged the vehicle passing near Macalin Nuur alley in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir).

On 17 May 2020, an VIED fitted to a vehicle owned by a Govt soldier (assumed military) detonated near Suuq-Boocle Village neighborhood in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). Al shabaab claimed the responsility of the attack.

On 16 May 2020, around thirty Hargeisa municipality employees protested in front of their office against unpaid salaries for the last five months in Hargeysa town (Hargeysa, Waqooyi Galbeed). Police dispersed them and there were no reports of causalities. [size=around 30]

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)

notes: On 16 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked AMISOM troops (Kenya)/ Jubaland security forces base in Bilis Qooqaani (Afmadow, Lower Juba). After heavy exchange of gunfire, five Al shabaab militants were killed, others captured and were arrested.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On 16 May 2020, a group of Al shabaab militants attacked AMISOM troops base at Arbacow village near Afgooye town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The fighting was initiated with three RPGs followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire from both sides and Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 15 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched an attack on Govt (military) checkpoints located outside of Awdheegle town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The clash was initiated with Rocket Propelled Grenade (RPGs) followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 15 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out an attack against a Govt military base located in Sabiid village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Both sides engaged in an exchange of heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants withdrew. An uncomfirmed number of casualties were reported.

On 15 May 2020, a group of Al shabaab militants attacked Govt forces (military) based at Makuundo village (Baydhaba,Bay). After heavy exchange of gunfire, four Al shabaab militants were killed and the militants retreated from the area.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: On 15 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked the AMISOM (Kenya) base in Afmadow town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). Al shabaab claimed that they killed one Kenyan soldier in the attack.

On 15 May 2020, a Govt soldier (assumed military) armed with AK47 gun shot and killed a male Tuktuk motorcycle driver at Arafat village in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). The district police attended the scene, but no arrests were reported.

On 14 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt soldier (Military) who was traveling by motorcycle in a suburb of Bariire town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al shabaab claimed that they killed the soldier, destroyed the motorcycles and confiscated his AK 47.

On 14 May 2020, an IED detonated by Al Shabaab targeted a motorbike carrying two Govt soldiers (military) on the road between Cabdow Dibile and Afgoye town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The explosion killed one soldier.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
notes: On 14 May 2020, Al shabaab militants conducted an attack against the Puntland Dervish base in the Galgala area (Bossaso, Bari). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 14 May 2020, Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at Govt forces (assumed military) as they passed through Ceelasha Biyaha village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al shabaab claimed to have killed two soldiers in the attack and the soldiers reacted with heavy gunfire.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On 14 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked an AMISOM base near K60 village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, several AMISOM soldiers were injured and Al shabaab militants retreated.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
notes: On 14 May 2020, Al shabaab militants staged an attack on a Puntland Dervish base in Balli-Khadar village (Bossaso, Bari). Three Al shabaab militants were killed in the fight.

On 14 May 2020, a group of police officers clashed with military forces at Zoona K village in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). Four Govt forces were killed (both police and military) after a heavy exchange of gunfire. The motive of the clash was related to disagreement over the smuggling of Khat/Miraa.

On 14 May 2020, Govt forces (military) attacked an Al shabaab base between Captain-Laas and Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, Govt forces claimed to have killed five militants, including one senior leader.
On 14 May 2020, unidentified persons threw a hand grenade at the house of a Galmudug police officer near Galkacyo central police station in Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug).

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: On 14 May 2020, an unidentified man, suspected to be a khaat trader, opened gunfire at security forces (assumed police) stationed near the southern checkpoint in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal). The security forces returned fire, but the vehicle and its occupant escaped from the scene.
On 14 May 2020, suspected Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt security officer near Suuqa Galeyda section of Bakara Market in Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag district (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir).

On 14 May 2020, Al shabaab militants abducted two civilian businessmen from Buale town and took them to an unknown destination (Bu'aale, Middle Juba). The exact motive behind abduction remains unclear.

On 14 May 2020, Govt forces (military), while on a security operation, engaged in an armed confrontation with Al shabaab militants at Bilile village (Diinsoor, Bay). After a brief exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 13 May 2020, unidentified men shot and killed a well-known businessman at the vicinity of Banadir junction road in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan,Banadir). Govt soldiers conducted security search operation, but no arrests were reported. The perpetrators stole a smart phone from the victim and managed to escape.

On 13 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier (military) in the Lafoole area (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The perpetrators escaped with an AK47 from the victim. Govt soldiers conducted a security search operation and arrested one suspected Al shabaab militant.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On 13 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack targeting an AMISOM forces base in El Wak town (Ceel Waaq, Gedo). Both sides engaged in heavy machine guns and small arms fires and Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 13 May 2020, an IED planted along the roadside exploded, targeting Govt forces (Military) convoy from Afgoye heading to Mogadishu near Ceelasha Biyaha village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). No further reports of casualty or damage.

On 13 May 2020, two groups of Govt troops (assumed military) engaged in a confrontation near Kaaran Police Station in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir), with both sides exchanging heavy gunfire. The clash was related to clan revenge between two sub clans of Abgaal clan.

On 13 May 2020, Govt forces (assumed military) during a security operation ambushed three Al shabaab militants who were riding a motorbike near Ceel Gudo village (Tayeeglow, Bakool). After a brief exchange of small arms fire, the militants managed to escape from the area and one militant was killed in the incident.

On 12 May 2020, suspected Al shabaab militants shot and killed a police officer in Ceelasha Biyaha settlement (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The perpetrators stole an AK47 gun from the victim and managed to escape. Police conducted a search operation and arrested one Al shabaab suspect.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force

The motive behind the shooting incident was retaliation against the police who are enforcing the coronavirus decree banning khaat trading and use in Puntland.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
notes: On 12 May 2020, suspected US forces conducted an airstrike against Al Shabaab militants near Haawaay village (Sablaale, Lower Shabelle). Three Al shabaab militants were killed in the attack.

On 12 May 2020, a group of civilians demonstrated (mainly females and children) in an attempt to stop the demolition of their homes by attacking the police with stones at Tawakal village vicinity in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). Govt security personal shot and injured civilians in an attempt to disperse the demonstrators. [size=no report]

On 12 May 2020, unknown men threw a hand grenade at a police checkpoint in the Tarabuunka junction road neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). Soldiers (military) reacted with gunfire. Four people were injured by hand grenade blast.

On 12 May 2020, an INGO worker was injured when unidentified man threw a hand grenade at a house in Waaberi neighborhood in Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). The victim was in the midst of their Iftar (breaking fast) when the attack occurred.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
notes: On 12 May 2020, suspected US forces conducted an airstrike against an Al Shabaab militant training base in the vicinity of Jamaame town (Jamaame, Lower Juba). Two top Al shabaab militants were killed.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
notes: On 12 May 2020, unknown aircraft (assumed US military) conducted an airstrike against suspected Al shabaab locations in the vicinity of Arabow Village (Bu'aale, Middle Juba). Two civilian vehicles transporting goods from Mogadishu were affected by the aerial strike.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
notes: On 12 May 2020, United States military forces conducted an airstrike against Al shabaab militants near Ceel Cadde village (Garbahaarey, Gedo).
On 11 May 2020, a land mine by Al shabaab militants targeted Ethiopian troops deployed in Waajid town (Waajid, Bakool). The blast killed two children and injured three others.

notes: On 11 May 2020, Danab special forces (Military), supported by the friendly forces (assumed US military), conducted a joint security operation targeting an Al shabaab stronghold in the vicinity of Arabow Village (Bu'aale, Middle Juba). The operation resulted in the killing of three Al shabaab militants.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: On 11 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Jubaland security forces base in Bar-Sanguun village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). After a heavy exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants claimed to have killed three soldiers and taken their weapons.

On 11 May 2020, two armed militias (assumed Ayr sub clan and Saleban sub clan) clashed after a land dispute in Dhusamareeb town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). The clans were engaging in a longterm land dispute.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: On 11 May 2020, Al-Shabaab fighters attacked an AMISOM/Govt forces (military) defensive base at Embareeso village (Baraawe, Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire before Al shabaab militants were forced to withdrew from the area.

On 11 May 2020, Al shabaaab militants carried out a hit and run attack against Govt forces in the Makiin area near Gumburlaawe village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). Govt troops were providing protection services to the local authority emergency response team when the incident happened.

On 11 May 2020, Al shabaab militants engaged in an armed clash with Govt forces' (military) in the vicinity of the main bridge in Qoryooley town (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants were forced to withdraw from the area.

On 11 May 2020, ministers, security officials and elders held a meeting at Xananbuuro village (Dhuusamarreeb,Galgaduud) to negotiate a ceasefire between local Ayr sub clan and Saleban sub clan groups of the Habargidir clan. The two opposing sides accepted the ceasefire, and a committee was nominated to finalize the issue.
On 11 May 2020, Al shabaab militants threw two hand grenades at soldiers in the Laanta Axmed Gurey neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan,Banadir). The soldiers reacted with heavy gunfire.

On 10 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt security (military) base camp in the vicinity of Golweyn village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After heavy exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants was forced to withdraw.

On 10 May 2020, a Govt soldier (military) armed with an AK47 gun shot and killed a male Tuktuk motorcycle driver at Juungal village in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid,Banadir). The District Police attended the scene, but no arrests were reported.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: On 9 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked Jubaland security forces in the vicinity of Bar-Sanguun village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). After heavy gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants claimed to have killed two soldiers and injured five others.

On 9 May 2020, armed militias from the Celi sub clan and Reer Matan sub clan of Abgal clan clashed in Maxaa Deex village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). The motive for the clash was a land dispute between the two sub clan militias.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
notes: On 9 May 2020, Govt soldiers opened fire on a civilian vehicle passing near INJI base in Dhuusamarreeb town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). The driver and two others were wounded and they were rushed to the hospital. The motive behind this attack is unknown.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On 9 May 2020, Al shabaab militants fired three mortar rounds impacting in and around Halane base camp which houses AU forces at the Adan Ade international airport in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir).

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: On 9 May 2020, Islamic state militants attacked a Puntland security forces post at the main market area in Bossaso town (Bossaso, Bari). PSF captured the vehicle used by the IS militants along with some UVIEDs, weapons and ammunition,. Two were killed, one from each side, and two others injured.
On 9 May 2020, armed militias from Ayr sub clan of Habar Gedir clan exchanged gunfire in Dhuusamarrereb town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). The fight was due to a land dispute between the clan.

On 9 May 2020, a Govt soldier shot and killed a civilian minibus driver at the Jamhuuriya village in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). The shooting occurred after the driver approached checkpoint. He reportedly ignored instructions to stop and the soldier shot at him after mistaking him to be Al shabaab militant.

On 9 May 2020, Al shabaab militants killed a civilian from Jareer-Weyne sub clan in Quracle village (Balet Weyne,Hiraan). The victim was chewing khat/mira, a substance banned by Al shabaab militants in their areas of control. Another khat user was abducted.
On 9 May 2020, Al shabaab militants hurled a hand-grenade at the Kahda police station in Mogadishu-Kaxda district (Kaxda,Banadir). Police Forces reacted with heavy gunfire.

On 9 May 2020, a group of police clashed with Govt forces (military) when they refused to stop at a checkpoint in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir). Both side exchange heavy gunfire until the Mogadishu mayor intervened. Two soldiers were injured in the incident.
On 9 May 2020, Govt forces (assumed military) took control over Qaayib (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud) and Cadakibir villages from Al Shabaab militants. No clash reported.

On 9 May 2020, police guards opened fire on prisoners who were trying to escape from Burco central prison in Burco town (Burco, Togdheer). Two prisoners sustained major injuries and they were rushed to Burco hospital.

On 9 May 2020, two Al shabaab militants attacked a police officer at Seybiyaano neighborhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The militants shot the police officer but also sustained injuries and when they tried to escape people nearby captured them and handed them over to the police.

On 8 May 2020, a remote controlled IED device planted by Al Shabaab on a roadside exploded, targeting Govt forces (military) in the vicinity of Qalimow village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). The explosion killed one soldier and injured four others.

On 8 May 2020, militiamen from the Leelkayse clan and Saad sub-clans briefly exchanged gun shots at Laama-Balaar near Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudugu). A Saad man was killed during the clash, which was connected to recent retaliations between the clans.

On 8 May 2020, Al shabaab militants abducted three staff working for an NGO from the area between Hoosingow and Dhobley town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). They had travelled to Hoosingow in a rented vehicle when armed Al shabaab militants forcefully took them, along with their vehicle to unknown location.

On 8 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt security officer (assumed military) at K60 Settlement (Marka,Lower Shabelle). The assailants managed to steal the AK47 gun and escaped from the scene.

On 8 May 2020, armed militias from the Hawadle and Jarer Weyne clans battled in Shiirkaneeco village near Balet Weyne town (Balet Weyne, Hiraan). The two sides exchanged small arms fire, resulting in the death of a local man by a stray bullet. The motive behind the clash was related to disputed grazing land.

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On 8 May 2020, Al shabaab militants ambushed a Govt forces' (military) vehicle in the Sayga forest between Ceel-Gilow and Gololey village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). Subsequent search operations by AMISOM/Govt Forces managed to recover the vehicle and two other motorcycles that were taken by Al shabaab militants.

On 7 May 2020, a remote controlled IED device exploded, targeting a Govt forces (military) convoy near Bali Doogle village (Wanla Weyne, Lower Shabelle). The explosion destroyed logistic vehicles and Al shabaab claimed to have killed one soldier.

On 7 May 2020, two police officers shot civilians vehicles transporting IDPs in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The vehicles had been transporting the IDPs to Garasbaaley camp from Hawl Wadaag district where they receive non-food items and cash for Iftar. Three people were injured including a driver.
On 7 May 2020, an RCIED exploded targeting a security forces convoy (military) passing near Warmahan village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

On 7 May 2020, a remote controlled IED device planted near a police checkpoint detonated at Hoosh junction road in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The device exploded while a security vehicle passed the area. At least three people were killed in the explosion.

On 7 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a security forces personnel (military) who was sitting in front of his house, at Asluubta village in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The police forces conducted search operation, and arrested several persons, Al shabaab also confiscated AK47 gun from the victim.

On 7 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed the head of Afgooye district sports chairman at Hawo-Cabdi village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The victim was in the mosque praying when the militants killed him.

On 7 May 2020, Govt forces (military) while conducting an operation clashed with Al shabaab militants in the vicinity of Awdheegle village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). 14 Al shabaab militants were killed in the fight.

On 7 May 2020, Al shabab militants attacked a Govt forces (assumed military) base in Awdheegle village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The two sides engaged in heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants claimed to have killed 3 soldiers and withdrew from the area.

On 7 May 2020, a hand grenade was thrown by Al Shabaab militants at Hamar Weyne police sation in Mogadishu-Hamar Weyne district (Hamar Weyne, Banadir). Police reacted with gunfire towards the attackers and three police officers were injured in the attack.
On 6 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier (assumed off-duty) at Garas Barey (Wanla Weyn, Lower Shabelle). The victim was leaving a mosque at the time.

On 6 May 2020, a policeman shot and injured a male Tuktuk motorcycle driver at Waraha-adde village in Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa,Banadir). The district police attended the scene for investigation.

On 6 May 2020, a roadside RCIED targeted a police vehicle from Elasha Biyaha heading to Mogadishu in the Tabeelaha Weydow neighborhood in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The IED missed its target and impacted a civilian toyota pickup owned by BECO (Banadir Electronic Company).
On 6 May 2020, Al shabaab militants abducted two boys from a household in Mulqeey village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). The militants wanted to enlist them in their movement.

On 6 May 2020, armed militiamen from the Ayr sub-clan of Habar Gedir clan shot and killed a civilian pastoralist from the Saleban sub-clan of Habar Gedir clan in the vicinity of Miiracad village (Cabudwaaq, Galgaduud). The motive behind his death was clan retaliation.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: On 6 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a convoy of AMISOM forces travelling from Jowhar town near Xaaji-Cali village (Xaaji-Cali, Cadale). After heavy exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 6 May 2020, Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at Govt forces (assumed military) in KBB neighborhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan,Banadir). Government forces opened gunfire in response. The explosion killed one soldier.

On 5 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked Govt forces (assumed military) in Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). The two sides allegedly exchanged heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 5 May 2020, unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a Govt Forces (assumed military) position at Laanta Taleex district branch office in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). Government forces opened gunfire after the explosion and perpetrators managed to escape.

On 5 May 2020, a group of people mainly women and youth staged a protest in Dinsoor town in support of the release of the former district commissioner of Dinsoor who had been in Baidoa prison for months (Diinsoor,Bay). The protesters were chanting slogans in support of the former DC and appreciation of the South-West President. [size=no report]

On 5 May 2020, a civilian man was injured after militiamen from Saad clan of Habar Gidir clan opened gun fire on a small football playing field in Garsoor section (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The motive of shooting was not clear, and perpetrators managed to disappear from the spot.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force

Al shabaab militants fired three mortar rounds accompanied by heavy weaponry towards the base and Jubaland forces responded with heavy firing power. Al shabaab retreated.

On 5 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a police officer (assumed off-duty) who worked in the Airport police station at Dabakayow Madow village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The victim was coming from his home and the police arrested several people in relation to the killing.

On 5 May 2020, a hand grenade was thrown at a Govt forces (assumed police) checkpoint near Suuq-Bacaad neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the attackers' general direction and the police troops chased and apprehended a suspect in Yaqshid police station.

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On 5 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces (military)/AMISOM defensive base in Qoryoley (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). The fighting was initiated with an RPG followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants retreated.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
notes: On 5 May 2020, Puntland Dervish forces ambushed an Islamic State base near Af-Urur village (Iskushuban, Bari). After heavy gunfire from both sides, Islamic state militants escaped from the area. One militant was killed and several others injured.

On 4 May 2020, around 30 Ethiopian refugees and asylum seekers protested on the roadside between ministry of finance and the Presidential palace in Hargeysa town (Hargeysa, Waqooyi Galbeed). The refugees were complaining against an UN office for not providing support in terms of food and shelter for them. [size=around 30]

On 4 May 2020, men suspected to be Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at Indhafiiq Govt forces (assumed military) in Hilaac neighborhood of Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag district (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir). The hand grenade impacted at an open ground not far from the Govt soldiers.

On 4 May 2020, a brief exchange of fire took place between two groups of security forces (assumed military) at Korontada junction road near a police checkpoint in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir).

On 4 May 2020, Ethiopia troops (non-Amisom) shot down an African express plane near Bardaale airport in Bardaale town (Buur Hakaba,Bay). Two Somali citizens and four Kenyan citizens died in the incident. The plane was carrying humanitarian assistance from Mogadishu.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force

notes: On 4 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt force (Jubaland security forces) and AMISOM defensive base in Afmadow town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants were forced to withdrew.

notes: On 4 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces (assumed military) defensive base in Ceel Salini settlement (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). On 4 May 2020, Al shabaab militants fired three mortar bombs which landed in and around koonis stadium in Mogadishu-Abdiaziz district (Abdiaziz, Banadir). The militants were targeting Govt officials in the stadium.

On 4 May 2020, unidentified man armed with a knife stabbed a famous Kalsan TV journalist to death at the Seybiano village in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The motive for this murder is not clear and perpetrator attempted to escape from the scene, but District Police Forces arrived and arrested him to CID for further interrogation.
On 4 May 2020, Al shabaab militants fired a mortar which landed in Behaani village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir).

On 4 May 2020, armed militiamen from the Ayr and Saleban sub clans of Habargidir clashed in the vicinity of Qalanqal village (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). Three people were killed and ten others injured. The motive of the fighting was related to a grazing land dispute.

On 4 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched an attack on a Govt forces (assumed military) base near Bariirre town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy fight, five militants and one soldier were killed. Al shabaab retreated from the area.
On 4 May 2020, Al shabaab militants abducted a Govt soldier (off-duty) who was traveling on a civilian minibus between Qalimow and Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle).

On 3 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked Govt forces base in Saabid village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab retreated and claimed to have killed two soldiers in the attack.

On 3 May 2020, Govt forces, while conducting an operation, clashed with Al shabaab militants collecting tax in the vicinity of Jamaame town (Jamaame, Lower Juba). After an exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 3 May 2020, Al shabaab fighters attacked a Govt (assumed military) position in the vicinity of Alamada village settlement at Lafoole (Afgooye,Lower Shabelle). The two sides allegedly exchanged heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 3 May 2020, Sacad clan militiamen of Habar Gedir clan clashed with a Leelkayse clan militia at Teerage village, west of Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). Two people were killed in the clash, which was related to previous case of revenge revenge and a land dispute between the two clans.

On 3 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Koranic school teacher at Hawo-Cabdi village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Security forces attended the place and conducted security operations in the area.

On 3 May 2020, two Khat smugglers were shot and killed by police who were enforcing a ban on khat trading in Somaliland regions to stop the spread of coronavirus pandemic in Hargeysa town (Hargeysa, Waqooyi Galbeed).

On 3 May 2020, Al shabaab militants conducted a Sharia court which sentenced to death and executed a young male in Public Square for allegedly being an American spy in the centre of Adan Yabaal District (Adan Yabaal, Middle Shabelle).

On 3 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a South-west administration Govt soldier (off-duty) in Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). The victim was heading to his house coming from mosque, Al shabaab militants took his weapon.
On 3 May 2020, local journalists held rallies in Mogadishu (Mogadishu City, Banadir) to protest against their working conditions. [size=no report]

On 2 May 2020, Banadir police clashed with Govt soldiers at Al cadala junction near Gumbacoole in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). One person was killed in the clash and several others injured.

On 2 May 2020, the police authorities shot and killed two persons smuggling illegal Khat in Baligubadle town (Hargeysa,Waqooyi Galbeed). Government enforcement of a ban on khat trading in Somaliland has been tightened to stop the spreading of Coronavirus.

On 2 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier (assumed military) near Mayafulka (Baydhaba, Bay). The victim was heading to the Govt post at Mayafulka when Al shabaab fighters ambushed and killed him on the road and took his weapon.

On 2 May 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Govt forces' (assumed military) position at Ceel Salini village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, Al Shabaab fighters withdrew.

On 2 May 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces (assumed military) base at Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Govt soldiers repelled the militants from the base, while Al Shabaab claimed to have killed four soldiers in the attack.

On 2 May 2020, a group of Al shabab militants attacked a Govt (assumed military) troop position at Weydow village in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile,Banadir). The two sides engaged in heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants withdrew from the area.

On 2 May 2020, an UVIED attached to the private vehicle of the Kahda District Commissioner (DC) exploded at Hoosh junction road village in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley,Banadir). The vehicle was carrying the DC's family when the device exploded. No further details on casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)

In Jilib, Al Shabaab militants have reportedly been killed by US air force's airstrike; including five top al-Shabab foreign officers from Afghanistan, Yemen, Sudan, German and Syria. The site hit was reportedly home to 543 Al Shabaab militants. The US didn't confirm the numbers but Somali security sources reportedly cited 310 to the media. Coded as 10 until other figures have been confirmed.

09 April. Al Shabaab militants ambush and torch a transport vehicle carrying charcoal outside the town of Balcad. Casualties unknown.
08 April. Units of the Somali military raided the house of Maxamed Cabdi Tool, the Governor of Bakool province to protest not being paid salaries for months.
08 April. A police officer with unknown motive shot and killed a civilian man in Hargeysa.
08 April. Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade west of Beledweyne town and a person was reportedly injured.
08 April. Police retaliated with gunfire after their vehicle was targeted by an IED in Hawl Wadag.
08 April. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a man near Kahda bus station in Hodan district.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 08 April. Al Shabaab militants ambushed military and AMISOM forces in Sabid. Soldiers and AMISOM forces later launched an operation that led to the arrest of nine militants including a senior bomb maker (coded separately).

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 08 April. After they were ambushed in Sabid, Somali military forces and AMISOM conducted an operation, arresting nine Al Shabaab militants including a senior bomb maker.
07 April. Dhulbahante militias with unspecified number of battle wagons, attacked Somali military base at Tuka-raq in Laas Caanod.
07 April. Al Shabaab and Islamic State fighters clashed at Karimo area (coordinates approximate; 20km SW of Qandala) in Bari region. No casualties reported.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 07 April. Al Shabaab militants conducted a hit and run attack against AMISOM troops in Buufow settlement.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 07 April. AMISOM forces were targeted with an IED in Bulo Mareer.
07 April. A RCIED detonated by Al Shabaab at a South West State Police position in Buurhakaba town injuring some police members.
07 April. A roadside IED exploded and hit a vehicle in the Gutale neighborhood of Daynile district, injuring the occupants including a doctor. No group claimed responsibility.
07 April. Suspected Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at Somali military soldiers in Wardhigley but the grenade landed at an empty place and caused no casualties.
07 April. A gunman killed a police officer in Hodan. Motive unknown.
06 April. Soldiers of the Somali military forces gathered and held a peaceful demonstration in Xudur in protest of payment issues [size=no report].

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 06 April. AMISOM forces reacted with gunshots after their vehicle was targeted by an IED in Siinka Dheer.
06 April. An IED planted in Howlwadag district exploded and injured at least three civilian bystanders.
06 April. Police reacted with gunfire after suspected Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at the Ex-Cinema Nasri Checkpoint in Hodan District.
06 April. Alleged Al Shabaab militants shot and killed two government soldiers in Weydow Village, Deynile District.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 05 April. Jubaland and Somali military forces attacked Al Shabaab militants in Bar Sangui.
05 April. Al Shabaab ambushed two donkey carts transporting commercial goods close to Abag-Tag village in Bay, abducting the owners and burning down the carts and the donkeys.
05 April. Al Shabaab cut off the right hand of a civilian accused of stealing in Xabaal-Barbaar village.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 05 April. A Somalia military intelligence officer and his driver were killed by unknown gunmen in Warshik area. No report of gunfire exchange.
05 April. A UVIED attached to the vehicle of a former MP exploded in Hodan district injuring a civilian.
05 April. A blast occurred in the Dabhka junction in Mogadishu. Casualties and motives unknown.
04 April. A vehicle packed with IEDs exploded in Xamar jajab injuring at least seven people.
04 April. One person was killed when a car bomb exploded near General Kahiye Police Academy in Mogadishu, the attack was claimed by Al Shabaab.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
notes: 04 April. A woman was killed and six other people were injured when Bancroft and US forces allegedly opened fire against a vehicle and residents of Ugunji village.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
notes: 04 April. Two civilians were allegedly killed due to an air strike by the US military in Mogadishu.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 03 April. Al Shabaab militants and AMISOM forces fought in Marka town. The clash followed an ambush by the former two days before in Afgoye.
03 April. A RCIED targeting a local administration personnel and placed next to a house detonated in Qansax-Dheere town, damaging properties.
02 April. Somali military forces captured Balad Amin village in Lower Shabelle region from Al Shabaab.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 02 April. Jubaland military force said that it killed Al Shabaab militants in air strikes conducted in Buale in Middle Jubba Region. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
01 April. A clan elder was abducted by armed gunmen on the outskirts of Balcad town.
01 April. Four police officers were killed when Al Shabaab militants attacked Afgoye district.
01 April. Al Shabaab militants clashed with armed men loyal to Muktar Roobow near the south side of Abal village. One Al Shabaad militants killed.
01 April. Al Shabaab militants opened fire on a car near Lug-Habar village, leaving the driver killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
notes: 01 April. After a brief clash with Al Shabaab militants, Somali special forces (Danab) took over Anole settlement.
01 April. Rickshaw drivers held a protest after a municipal tax collector shot and killed one of their colleagues over a tax issue in Waberi district (coded separately). [size=no report]
01 April. Suspected Al Shabaab militants kidnapped a government worker and his two sons in Dharkinlay district.
01 April. In Waberi district, a Somali soldier gunned down a three-wheeler driver in Waberi district.
01 April. Unknown armed group killed two Somali soldiers in Afgoye.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 31 March. Al Shabaab detonated an IED at the AMISOM base in Gololey.
31 March. Armed group shot and killed two tax collectors near Afgoye bus station in Afgoye town.
31 March. Two militias of Dhulbahante sub-clans clashed in Buhodle town. Motive unknown.
31 March. An IED placed in a garbage pile exploded in Hawl Wadg district but caused no casualty.
31 March. Suspected Al Shabaab militants killed a Somali soldier in Gahayr University in Daynile district.
30 March. A soldier of the Somali military forces killed a suspected Al Shabab militant, who was plotting to kill civilians in Karan district.
30 March. Somali police forces exchanged fire with guards at the Universal TV HQ in Mogadishu. Reason for the attack unknown and no casualties reported.
30 March. A hand grenade was thrown at police officers in Baidoa. Some injuries were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 30 March. Jubaland military forces clashed with suspected Al Shabaab militants at grazing area south west of Kismayo town.
30 March. Al Shabaab publicly executed four men north east of Kismayo town for allegedly helping Somali troops and spying for foreign intelligence agencies.
30 March. A UVIED attached to a Somali soldier's vehicle exploded near Hajji Gabow village in Dharkenley district.
29 March. More than 20 missiles were fired in airstrikes against a suspected Al Shabaab logistical hub west of Bu'ale town.
29 March. Al Shabaab militants attacked a Somali military position in Qoryoley district.

29 March. Al Shabaab militants burned three trucks that were carrying charcoal between Jowhar and Balcad district in Middle Shabelle region. No casualties (coded as if civilians not in the trucks at the time of the attack).
29 March. Security forces reacted with fire after suspected Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at Somali military forces positioned at Lanta Towfiq in Yaqshid district.
29 March. A security guard of the commander of Hirshabelle coastal guards shot and killed a business woman at the khat market in Karan district. Motive unknown.
28 March. A series of explosions by Al Shabaab in Mogadishu killed at least 15 people and injured 17 others.
28 March. Unknown armed group killed a businessman in Dharkenley.
28 March. Injuries and fatalities occurred after a VBIED exploded near Hotel Weheliye in Howlwadaag district. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the explosion. Unknown fatalities coded as 10
28 March. Al Shabaab militants attacked a village near Dhobley and exchanged gunfire with the Jubaland security forces. There were reports of fatalities and injuries (unknown fatalities coded as 10)

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 28 March. Al Shabaab militants attacked an SNA/AMISOM defensive base in Bullo Mareer.
28 March. A peaceful protest was held by a group of internally displaced people demonstrated against the Mayor of Hargeisa in Hargeisa for not providing them land to settle. [size=no report]

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 27 March. An airstrike by Kenyan forces destroys a Hormuud telecom center in Jaldeys village near Afmadow town.
27 March. A Southwest police officer, who was walking to his house was killed by a hand grenade in Qansaxdhere.
27 March. Al Shabaab attacked Somali police by RCIED, police responded with gunshots in the direction of the attack.
27 March. An armed group clashed with the bodyguards of Colonel Mohamed Buule after the former hurled a hand grenade at the Colonel's house.
26 March. At least four people were killed due to an explosion in Mogadishu.
26 March. Al Shabaab militants executed five men in public by firing squad in Yaq Barawe accused of spying.
26 March. Casualties reported when unidentified war planes conducted airstrikes at Al Shabaab position in Luuq Jeelow.
26 March. Al Shabaab militants burnt down a house of a soldier of the Somali military forces near Moorgaabey village and stole dozens of livestock from the residence of the soldier.
26 March. Suspected Al Shabaab militants launched an attack on Somali military forces located near Golweyn village (c. 22 km north west of Merka district).
26 March. Somali military forces killed a senior Al Shabaab officer in Jambaluul.
26 March. An IED exploded near Buurane close to the AMISOM base. There were damages to properties.
26 March. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a senior Somali national army officer and a civilian bystander in Kaaran district.

26 March. A UVIED explosion occurred in Hodan district, which was attached to a private Toyota type vehicle owned by an unidentified person. Fatalities and injuries were reported (unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).
26 March. Due to argument over current crisis of salary non-payment, one of state house soldiers shot and severely injured his commander at Villa Somalia vicinity in Wardhigley district.
25 March. One person died and three others were injured after a blast targeted a car in Hodan neighborhood near Albaraka.
25 March. A landmine hit a car owned by Simad University. The driver was confirmed dead & security guard is injured.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 25 March. Al Shabaab militants seized farming villages near Bal'ad town after the withdrawal of Somalia military forces from the area over months of missed pay.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 25 March. Jubaland military and Somali national army have defused an IED that was planted near Bar-Sanguni during a joint security operation against suspected Al Shabaab location.
24 March. Al Shabaab militants took control of Hawaadley village (c. 34 km south of JAF). Unclear if clashes, nocasualties mentioned.
24 March. A Somali military soldier injured a civilian minibus driver and a passenger in Afgoye district.
23 March. In Warshadaha street in Daynile district two people were killed in a blast.
23 March. A blast hit Hawl Wadag district but the casualties are unknown.
23 March. A blast in Ex-Control Afgooye killed seven people.
23 March. AS set off explosions and stormed government ministries in Mogadishu, police and the military fought back AS and rescued people. 10 killed.
23 March. A RCIED placed in a restaurant targeting police forces detonated in Baidoa. No casualties.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 23 March. Al Shabaab damaged a Government soldiers' vehicle by RCIED in Dharkenley district. Dead and injured reported (unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).
23 March. Gunfire exchange occurred after police were targeted by a hand grenade near Howlwadag junction road area in Howlwadag district.
22 March. A government soldier killed a civilian government worker in Mogadishu.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 22 March. AMISOM Djiboutian forces clashed with Al Shabaab at Ceel Lafole vicinity. Al Shabaab retreated from the area, two of its militants were injured.
22 March. South West Special Police Force fought with security guards of the district finance officer in Buurhakaba town.
22 March. An RCIED exploded at Southwest police's checkpoint in Qansax-Dheere town. Dead and injured (unknown fatalities coded as 10).
22 March. An unknown war plane conducted an airstrike targeting suspected Al Shabaab positions at the outskirts of Bu'ale town.
22 March. SNAF and Police clashed in Hodan District divided along clan lines namely Hawiye and Habargidir sub clans over land. Dead and injured (unknown fatalities coded as 10).
22 March. A hand grenade was hurled at police in Hodan District. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the suspected direction of the attack.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 22 March. Somali military shot and killed a NISA soldier in Waberi district. Motive unknown.
22 March. Disagreement over measures to be taken against captured AS fighters led to clashes between two groups of government soldiers in Marka; two soldiers died.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 21 March. Somali military forces and AMISOM Ethiopian forces captured many suspected Al Shabaab militants in Mogadishu. Hundreds more were arrested on March 25 in Mogadishu.
21 March. A Somali government soldier shot dead a female colleague in the border town of Dhobley in Lower Jubba. Motive unknown.
21 March. An IED explosion in Mogadishu killed a Somali engineer. The device was fitted to the vehicle.
21 March. Police clashed with an armed group that opened fire on a checkpoint in Wardhigley district. One person was killed.
21 March. A UVIED exploded in Hodan district killing a private contractor, who owned the car.
21 March. At least five Kenyan Defense Forces soldiers were killed in a roadside bomb in Elwak, Somalia.
20 March. A RCIED targeted SNA soldiers on Kenyan forces' convoy. Five soldiers were injured.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 20 March. AMISOM forces opened fire after RCIED targeted their convoy in Balcad district.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 20 March. An IED targeting AMISOM troops exploded at Gololey. There were no casualties.
20 March. Suspected AS fighters attacked government forces in Hodan resulting in an exchange of fire between the two sides.
20 March. A UVIED attached to a private vehicle owned by an unidentified person exploded in Hodan district. No casualties reported.
20 March. Two suspected AS elements shot and killed a civil servant in Howlwadag district.
20 March. A suspected AS fighters shot and killed a government soldier and khat dealer at in Boondheere District.
19 March. Following an argument over an unknown issue a soldier of the SNA shot and injured a police officer in Hawl wadag.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 19 March. Following the pull out of Kenyan forces, Al Shabaab captured Busar in Gedo without battle.
19 March. AS forces conducted a hit and run attack on government forces but retreated from Balad at the end.
19 March. One soldier was shot and killed in Garsoor village, North Galkacyo, due to suspected internal dispute.
19 March. AS attacked SNA forces in Buirdhuubo. No casualties were reported and AS forces retreated.
19 March. AS and SNA forces exchanged fires after AS fighters launched an attack on their Defensive Base in Bangalay village vicinity. AS said it killed two soldiers.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 19 March. A RCIED reportedly planted on the roadside near Golweyne town by AS injured AMISOM soldiers.

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 18 March. AS militants carried out an attack against AMISOM & SNA defensive bases in Balcad District. One soldier was killed.
18 March. Two armed youth groups clashed in Hargeisa over territorial control. The leaders of the groups were arrested.
18 March. Ali Gari and Mohamed Barked Dhulbahante sub-clans signed peace deal in Buhoodle.
18 March. UVIED attached to the private vehicle of a female government staff member exploded in Hodan District. No casulty occurred and no group claimed responsibility.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
notes: 18 March. US drone strike targets a vehicle carrying Somali civilians at Adow Dibile village near Afgoye town. Al Shabaab claims civilian losses (low estimate coded as 3).

17 March. AS fighters attacked Somali military forces in Xhudur. Three AS fighters were reported dead in the clash.
17 March. An AS District Commissioner was killed in an operation carried out by Somali forces in Wanlaweyn district.

17 March. Al Shabab militants arrested two drivers before setting their minibus on fire as they were transporting charcoal in Awdheegle District neighborhood. The group had previously banned the charcoal business in their areas.
17 March. Esse Muse/Reer Mohamud sub clan militia shot and injured a man from Esse Musel /Reer Cadaawe sub clan in Xumbawayne village over a farmland dispute.
17 March. Unknown gunmen killed a man over clan revange at Docal village.
17 March. Dir clan carried raided Xeraale village but were repelled by locals.
17 March. Jubaland security forces accidentally clashed with suspected Anti-Terrorist Police Unit from Kenya based in Liboi-Kenya, in Dhobley town.
17 March. AS fighters attacked Jubaland forces in Diff village, 60 km from Dhobley. Two were killed. AS took over the village when the soldiers retreated.
17 March. Eli Omar and Abdullle Aroone sub clans clashed in Adale district, leaving 27 killed.
17 March. Al Shabaad seized a military base in Lower Shabelle after the soldiers withdrew from the base over lack of payment.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 17 March. RCIED planted by suspected Al Shabaab militants exploded on AMISOM forces, who reacted with gunfire. Civilians were injured.
17 March. In Hodan, a university student was killed by government soldiers. Reason unknown.
17 March. A government soldier opened fire on a three-wheel driver in Mogadishu's Hodan district.
17 March. A suspected AS student injured his Quran teacher in Beledwyene.
17 March. Locals killed an AS leader, who was hiding in their locality of Yaaqbiri Weyne.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 16 March. A roadside bomb exploded on an AMISOM troops' convoy near Bal'ad town. Casualties unknown.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
notes: 16 March. A joint US/Somali operation against Al Shabaab near Marka town left 22 militants killed.

15 March. Supected anti-Somaliland gunmen shot dead an SLA soldier in Lasanod. The motive of the killing remains unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)

13 March. 10 people were killed and 38 others injured when RCIEDs, that were reportedly targeting SNA soldiers, exploded near a teashop in a crowded market of gaduud-Buurey village.
13 March. AS fighters opened fire at an INGO rented vehicle near Caasho-Gaabo village. No casualties reported.

13 March. In Baidoa, a police officer shot and injured the driver of an INGO.

13 March. Kenyan warplanes conducted an airstrike against AS positions in Sheebow. Casualties unknown.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 13 March. An AS-led IED explosion targeted AMISOM forces in Celasha Biyah. AMISOM responded with gunfire. AS said it killed three AMISOM fighters.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force

notes: 13 March. Jubaland forces and SNA special forces conducted joint operation against AS locations south of Jamame town. Six militants killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force

notes: 13 March. Two groups of the Darawish forces clashed over an internal issue. Some soldiers were wounded.

notes: 13 March. Due to non-payment of salary, SNA soldiers peacefully demonstrated on the Main Street in Dayniile district. [size=70]

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)

12 March. Clashes between rival Hawiye and Darod militias over land dispute killed 2 fighters.
12 March. Soldiers reacted with fire after a hand grenade was hurled at a police checkpoint in Dayniile District.
12 March. Suspected AS militants shot and killed an unidentified youth, suspected to be a government soldier in Hodan District.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces

11 March. Al-Shabab fighters abducted elders from Gal-qoryale area in Guri'el District for allegedly not paying tax.
11 March. A civilian was injured when two groups of SNA and police exchanged gunfire in Wadajir district.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 11 March. NISA and SNPF removed a suspected VBIED from Hodan District.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)

10 March. Abgal militiamen killed two members of the Jareer clan in a clan based retaliation attack.

10-12 March. Units from Somaliland and Somali military set up bases in and around Yubbe District seeking to occupy all the areas in south and east of Sanag Region to protect Somaliland against attacks by Arre [ex-Somaliland military official] rebels.
09 March. SLA troops attacked rebel Colonel Caare and his militia from Qardho in Puntland in Yubbe.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 09 March. Weapons from seven fishery boats were seized by the Puntland Maritime Police Forces in Bosaso.
09 March. AS militants attacked SNA in Bullo Mareer, starting with rocket-propelled grenades (RPGs) and following with heavy gunfire.
09 March. A woman was shot dead by a SNA soldier at Ceel-Macaan village. Motive unknown.
09 March. A vehicle transporting vegetables from Deelholaa grazing area was damaged by an IED explosion.
09 March. Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at government troops at a Livestock Market, in Heliwa District, the soldiers reacted with gun fire.
09 March. A government soldier shot dead two alleged assassins plotting to kill him in Afgoye; he was informed by another civilian about the plot.
09 March. A suspected IS fighter gunned down an Al-Shabaab militant in Bosaso and escaped.
08 March. AS fighters have forcefully taken some livestock from Tayeegleey village.
08 March. A person hailing from the Omar Mahmoud clan was killed by an unknown person in Garowe.
08 March. A group of around 28 AS militants attacked and killed farmers in Ceel Muluq. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
08 March. In Daynile, a bomb that was being prepared in a house exploded prematurely.
07 March. Unknown armed persons shot and killed a female electoral delegate from Hirshabelle known as Bahsan Bolay in Boondheere district.
07 March. Two male civilians and three AS militants were killed when Somali forces backed by Bancroft attacked AS in the west of Jowhar town.

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 07 March. A platoon of AS attacked SNA soldiers and AMISOM forces in Mahady but were forced to withdraw by AMISOM.
07 March. Attack by AS militants on SNA in Ceel Muluq. Populations displaced eastwards.

07 March. At least 2 IED explosions targeted Jubaland forces 28km south of Kismayo, between Birole and Kismayo. Property damage mentioned and ensuing gunfire between the forces and the militants. AS withdrew.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 07 March. A Jubaland soldier shot and killed a male passenger and injured several others on a commercial vehicle at Bar-Sanguni village. Motive unknown.
07 March. A peaceful protest was held in Bosaso against the closure of the fish market located at the Bossaso Port. [size=100]

07 March. At least 2 IEDs exploded 28km south of Kismayo, between Birole and Kismayo: in the first explosion, a man was killed, in the second, a civilian lorry transporting goods was targeted, the explosion injured one female passenger. AS suspected as also targeted Jubaland forces in the area.
07 March. Troops loyal to Colonel Caare clashed with Somaliland Army soldiers in Yubbe. The army withdrew as they were outnumbered.
07 March. AS claimed responsibility for the explosion of a vehicle in a busy area of Bondhere district that resulted in fatalities and injuries (unknown fatalities coded as 10).

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 07 March. AMISOM were targeted by a RCIED in Daynile district resulting in damages and injuries.

07 March. A Somali elder Suldan Bashir, widely known in Puntland territories was killed in a mosque at Bosaso city. Motive unknown.
06 March. Suspected AS fighter died after exchanging small arms fire with security forces, who found him laying an IED on the road at Bacadaha.
06 March. A police officer killed a rickshaw driver in Baidoa but the cause of the killing is not known.
06 March. AS killed two civilians for failing to pay their contribution after the extra time of two weeks.

06 March. An IED that was planted near the main road near the bridge detonated prematurely at the east of Bulo-Burte town. Security forces arrived after the incident and confirmed the cause. AMISOM defused two RCIEDs in the area on this day.
06 March. SNA soldiers on patrol shot and killed an armed AS fighter in Bakaro Market, Howlwadag District.
06 March. Police were seriously injured after an RCIED targeting a Toyota vehicle carrying policemen exploded in Dayniile District. The police reacted with gun shots.
06 March. In Kaaran district, a Somali police officer shot and killed a civilian Tuktuk driver and injured some male bystanders at the Sanca junction road vicinity, Kaaran District. Motive unknown.
06 March. A roadside bomb killed at least seven, including 2 officials in the outskirts of Mogadishu.
05 March. Unidentified warplanes launched an airstrike targeting AS positions South East of Ceel Waaq district positions. Casualties unknown.
05 March. AS fighters were forced to retreat after they attacked and later were repelled by SNA forces in Marka.
05 March. A suspected AS fighter hurled a hand-grenade at government soldiers on foot patrol in Wardhigley District. The soldiers reacted with heavy gunfire.
05 March. Suspected AS fighter hurled a hand-grenade at the police checkpoint near Suuq-Bacaad market neighborhood. Casualties reported.
05 March. The US-trained Bancroft forces conducted an operation in an area near Janale town, where they allegedly robbed and looted civilians.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 05 March. Somaliland military and Puntland forces clashed twice in Gambara village due to the alleged entrance of Puntland forces in the border areas.
04 March. A retired military officer was killed in Mogadishu by AS fighters.
On 4 March 2019, a government soldier killed a lorry driver in Mogadishu town (Mogadishu city, Banadir). Motive unknown.
04 March. Government forces were attacked in Gambadha by the Dhulbahante Clan. Both sides sustained injuries.
04 December. Two groups of Gaal Jacel clan militia clashed over tax collected from road users.
04 March. A man from the Omar Mohamud sub-clan shot and killed a fellow clan member in Garsoor. Unclear reasons.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 04 March. AMISOM forces launched an artillery attack, targeting AS position at Wajid town.
04 March. Due to an unknown reason, a government soldier shot and killed a minibus driver.
04 March. Police detained some members of the AS alleged to be part of the intelligence wing.
04 March. A disabled elderly woman was shot dead by a police officer in an IDP camp in Wadajir.
03 March. The driver of a truck was killed when AS militants launched RPG rocket for failure to stop after being flagged down.
03 March. Government soldiers retaliate with gunfire when a hand grenade was hurled at them by suspected AS attackers.
03 March. Somaliland army officer was killed by his own colleague over unknown reasons in Lass caanood.
03 March. Suspected AS fighters shot and killed a government military officer heading to a livestock market in Beletweyne.
03 March. A truck carrying charcoal was burnt down by AS fighters East of Miir taqwo.
03 March. Injuries and property damages were recorded after a RCIED targeting the Garasbaley settlement Deputy District Commissioner exploded in Daynile.
03 March. Police officers fired gunshots when hand grenade was hurled at the police checkpoint in Hodan.
03 March. At least three AS fighters were killed when their own gun mistakenly exploded in Bariire.
02 March. A hand grenade targeting custom officers exploded near the custom office in Beletweyne. No casualty reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
notes: 02 March. Government regained control of the Galmudug state house after clan militias occupied it for a while in Cadaado Town.
02 March. Due to a dispute over a farmland, unknown armed groups clashed with militiamen at Xawadley village. Injuries were reported.
02 March. A government soldier returning to his home was killed by suspected AS fighters in Xamar Jaal.
02 March. Somalia government's national palace in Mogadishu has been attacked by mortars. Casualties unknown.
01 March. A security officer was killed after the security forces manning the southwest main exit checkpoint clashed with each other over their member insisting to release a vehicle.
01 March. A person hailing from the Qubeys clan group was shot dead by a person from the Sueliman clan. Motive unknown.
01 March. Casualties and injuries occurred, when unidentified assailants hurled a hand grenade at civilians in Baidoa.

notes: 01 March. A RCIED detonated outside the gate of the home of a prison commander. Properties were damaged.
01 March. Somalia's police force commander was targeted by RCIED in Beledweyne.
01 March. AS forces attacked and killed some government soldiers, who were checking their vehicles (unknown fatalities coded as 10).
01 March. A tuk tuk driver was killed by a police officer due to dispute over extortion of money.

notes: 01 March. Al Shabaab fighters overtook the Fahfahdhun after withdrawal of AMISOM Kenya forces. No mention of clashes.
